prompt: 72yo M w/ complicated effusion. right-sided tube. gave tpa/dnase initial dose. code 32561. no issues.
completion:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: 08/08/2025

INDICATION FOR OPERATION The patient is a 72-year-old male who presents with a pleural effusion and complicated effusion.

The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to the instillation of agents for fibrinolysis (initial) were discussed with the patient in detail.

CONSENT The patient indicated a wish to proceed with the procedure and informed consent was signed.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

Pleural Effusion

Complicated Effusion

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

Pleural Effusion

Complicated Effusion

PROCEDURE

Instillation of agents for fibrinolysis (initial day) via chest tube

CPT: 32561

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer throughout the entire procedure.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL The patient was assessed and the existing right-sided chest tube (inserted on 08/08/2025) was identified.

The following fibrinolytic agents were instilled via the chest tube:

Agents: tPA (10 mg) and DNase (5 mg)

Dosing: Dose #1

The medication was instilled without difficulty.

COMPLICATIONS None.

IMPRESSION / PLAN

72-year-old male who presents for instillation of agents for fibrinolysis (initial).

The patient tolerated the procedure well.

There were no immediate complications.

Disposition: Return to ward.

prompt: Please write a procedure note for a 72 year old male. We are doing the initial fibrinolysis instillation via the left-sided chest tube. Agents used were Alteplase 10 mg and Dornase 5 mg. Patient tolerated well.

Instillation of agents for fibrinolysis (initial day) via chest tube

CPT: 32561

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an independent trained observer throughout the entire procedure.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL The patient was assessed and the existing right-sided chest tube (inserted on 03/16/2025) was identified.

The following fibrinolytic agents were instilled via the chest tube:

Agents: Alteplase 10 mg and Dornase 5 mg

Dosing: Dose #1

The medication was instilled without difficulty.

COMPLICATIONS No immediate complications noted.

IMPRESSION / PLAN

47-year-old female who presents for instillation of agents for fibrinolysis (initial).

The patient tolerated the procedure well.

There were no immediate complications.

Disposition: Remains inpatient.
